original_text:
**INSTITUTION
GERIATRIC MEDICINE
TRANSFER SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY XXX ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Sep 18 2007]
TRANSFER DATE :
**DATE[Sep 25 07]
TRANSFERRED TO :
TCU
TRANSFERRED TO CARE OF :
TRANSFER DIAGNOSIS ( ES ) :
STATUS POST METASTATIC CANCER , ORIGIN UNKNOWN .
SECONDARY DIAGNOSIS ( ES ):
1. GLAUCOMA .
2. HISTORY OF BLADDER CANCER .
3. TRANSIENT ISCHEMIC ATTACK .
4. PNEUMONIA .
5. ACUTE RENAL FAILURE .
6. RIGHT LUNG NODULE .
7. COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT .
STUDIES :
The following studies were done : x-ray of the knee shows osteopenia with chondrocalcinosis .
X-ray of the femur shows moderate osteoarthritic changes of the medial joint space with a chondrocalcinosis .
No acute abnormality of the distal and proximal femur .
Last chest x-ray showed no acute infiltrates .
It was done on **DATE[Sep 19] .
CT of the abdomen shows a 1 cm low density lesion in the anterior segment of the right lobe of the liver which likely represents a cyst .
Also 1.6 cm low density lesion in the medial segment of the left lobe of the liver which probably represents hemangioma .
Spleen , pancreas , adrenals and kidneys are normal .
In pelvis , fibroid in the uterus .
There is no lymphadenopathy or free fluid .
Also in pelvis there is sclerotic destructive lesion at L5 , in right iliac wing , and in right greater trochanter consistent with the patient 's known history of metastatic disease .
There is also pathologic left femur fracture .
MRI brain shows no evidence of metastatic disease on the current examination .
MRI of the L - spine shows a diffuse infiltrate process consistent with metastatic disease .
MRI joint lower extremity showed ( 1 ) diffuse marrow replacement with more confluent metastatic foci involving the left greater trochanter , right sacroiliac joint and the L5 vertebral body , ( 2 ) a fracture through the greater trochanter , left femur and an impending intratrochanteric region left femur , ( 3 ) possible cortical breakthrough and local spread of neoplastic disease involving the soft tissues and muscles surrounding the left greater trochanter .
Bone scan showed ( 1 ) multiple foci concerning for metastatic disease , mainly in the right fifth rib , left medial scapula , L4 and L5 vertebral bodies , right iliac wing , left greater trochanter and right femoral diathesis , ( 2 ) multiple foci of abnormal uptake in the left of L1 and L3 vertebral bodies likely due to arthritic disease .
ISSUES :
Metastatic cancer , origin unknown .
The patient 's left lower extremity had severe pain which rendered the patient immobile .
Oncology team was consulted and orthopedics team was consulted .
Oncology was consulted due to highly suspicious that lesion at left side and also lung is metastatic in nature and the origin of the cancer is unknown .
Orthopedics was consulted because the patient cannot ambulate due to severe pain and also due to possibility of further fracture of the left lower extremity .
Orthopedics decided to take the patient to the surgery and to stabilize the patient and also to do biopsy to find out origin of the cancer .
Pulmonary nodules .
As I said , the patient has pulmonary nodules which are enlarging and spiculated and highly suspicious of the cancer .
No actions were taken for pulmonary nodules .
As I said above , oncology team was consulted which will follow the patient .
Cognitive impairment .
Currently , the patient is alert and oriented .
She has been cognitively confused in the mornings but during the day she has been alert .
Anxiety , depression .
The patient sometimes appears anxious during the hospital stay .
She is on Remeron .
The patient during hospital stay has been stable medically .
The patient is nonweightbearing and is on bed rest due to high risk of fracture .
Physical Therapy and Occupational Therapy were consulted to strengthen her upper extremities .
No activity for lower extremities again .
TRANSFER MEDICATIONS :
The patient is transferred to TCU on following medications :
1. Remeron 15 mg p.o. at hour of sleep .
2. Namenda 10 mg p.o. b.i.d.
3. Atenolol _________  , hold if the heart rate is lower than 60 , systolic blood pressure is less than 100 .
4. Travoprost 0.004% one drop right eye once a day .
5. Timoptic - XE 0.5% one drop left eye once a day .
6. Heparin 5,000 units subcu q. eight for DVT prophylaxis .
7. Tylenol 650 p.o. q. six hours .
8. Lactulose 30 mL p.o. b.i.d. for constipation .
9. Percocet one tablet p.o. q. four hours p.r.n. for pain .
Consult Medical Oncology , also Orthopedic Surgery in Shady - side .
Also on **DATE[Sep 29] , please call the following number to find out the OR scheduled time : the number is **PHONE .
It is important to arrange the patient 's transportation .
Again , on **DATE[Sep 29] please call **PHONE to find out the time of the surgery and arrange transportation next day .
TRANSFER INSTRUCTIONS :
The patient is in stable condition .
Disposition :
TCU .
The patient is to follow up with Oncology after getting orthopedic surgery when the patient arrives to **INSTITUTION .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY XXX ZZZ] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[VVV WWW] , M.D.
PK/lek
D :
**DATE[Sep 25 2007] 15:26:42
T :
**DATE[Sep 25 2007] 15:42:33
R :
**DATE[Sep 25 2007] 16:49:48/rs
Job ID :
361674 /**ID-NUM
CC :
Faxed to Unit 10 South
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[WWW , SSS] ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ]
**DATE[Oct 08 2007] 10:32:27 AM
